snippet: The United States Supreme Court denied the last-ditch appeals of Robert Wayne Holsey, who had killed a deputy sheriff after robbing a convenience store.
abstract: Robert Wayne-Hosley, convicted of 1995 murder of deputy sheriff, is executed by lethal injection after Georgia State Supreme Court rejects arguments by his lawyers that state’s unusually strict standard for judging mental disability violate Constitution; Holsey killed a deputy sheriff after robbing a convenience store in 1995.
lead_paragraph: The United States Supreme Court denied the last-ditch appeals of Robert Wayne Holsey, who had killed a deputy sheriff after robbing a convenience store.

headline.main: After Delay, Inmate Is Executed in Georgia
headline.print_headline: After Delay, Inmate Is Executed in Georgia
